Answer: It's kind of long, but I like this one, from near the end of "When Harry Met Sally" (admittedly, a bit of a knock-off of "Annie Hall").  I think it expresses the idea of knowing somebody thoroughly, and loving them despite their quirks:\n\n"I love that you get cold when it's 71 degrees out. I love that it takes you an hour and a half to order a sandwich. I love that you get a little crinkle above your nose when you're looking at me like I'm nuts. I love that after I spend the day with you, I can still smell your perfume on my clothes. And I love that you are the last person I want to talk to before I go to sleep at night. And it's not because I'm lonely, and it's not because it's New Year's Eve. I came here tonight because when you realize you want to spend the rest of your life with somebody, you want the rest of your life to start as soon as possible."

label: Health
sentence:
Question: What usually happens when you have a hiatus hernia and an erosion of the lower third of your esophagus?
Answer: Your doctor will want to aggressively manage your GERD. You will likely be prescribed a PPI (Proton-pump inhibitor ) medicine.

Your doctor will also want to check that the erosions have healed with a follow-up endoscopy in a few months.

A very small percentage of people with erosive esophagitis can develop scarring of the esophagus and esophageal narrowing leading to difficulty with swallowing. This is probably unlikely for you, as it would have been picked up during your endoscopy exam.

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Title: sales people often think you must be passionate about what you sell, but this is wrong, isn't it?
Question: you should be passionate about how you can help your prospect with your product, people buy for their own reasons, not because you are passionate about your product, right ?
Answer: I think I agree with what you're saying but to me it amounts to very similar things. Firstly, being "passionate" about your service/product doesn't necessarily mean that you dream about it night and day and climb onto a couch and bounce around while discussing its merits. It simply means that you convincingly believe that the offering is a valuable one. Realistically you also understand that this value may differ depending upon the needs of your potential clients.\n\nAnd so, a sales person may be passionate about Honda's because they realize that a Honda can be an extremely cost efficient and reliable automobile with strong performance for a consumer that values those attributes. However, if the defining attribute that the consumer is looking for is prestige, the Honda sales person will appreciate that a BMW or Mercedes may be a better fit. (Of course, you're unlikely to find this understanding in their sales pitch.)

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Question: how can i print my worksheet at excel?
Answer: Before you print, go to File>Print Preview, and look at where the dashed lines fall. These are the extents of the printed pages. Sometimes they can fall in between two columns, making for a very unreadable spreadsheet. You can fix this by changing the column widths or by going to File>Page Set Up and changing from portrait to landscape orientation. When you're happy with where the page extents fall, then go to File>Print.

Title: aspergers syndrome, is it hard to fit in?
Question: how do people with aspergers syndrome fit into society? i.e. what problems do they face and how do they overcome these problems?
Answer: as you probably know aspergers syndrome is on the autistic spectrum so lets say there is a scale of 1 to 10. depending on where you are on that scale the more severe symptoms there are ie 1 is low and 10 is high.

Aspergeric children do find it hard to relate and to have sympathy or empathy for others which can come acrros to others as being rude. This is a big developmental hurdle which is the main reason for why they dont fit in or are emotionally held back

In the right environment children with aspergers can intergrate very well. In schools depending on what part of the spectrum they fall, they may be better off in a main stream school maybe with the help of a learning support assistant. 

In the uk children can be statemented which will qualify them to have free extra support within a school.

Aspergeric children can be disruptive or sometimes the complete opposite and very introverted. As I said with the right support, patience and understanding of adults and peers they can do very well.

As for the teacher who commented that the aspergeric child she knows that "will never live alone"etc etc...
you cant say that about all aspergeric children. Children with severe problems are more likely to be autistic

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: Science question number 2 (earth sci)?
Question: True or False:

In dry seasons, some wells go dry because the water table drops.

If false, what is the correct answer.
Answer: That answer is true.

The water table rises & falls in response to rainfall amounts.

When there is little rain, the water table will lower thereby affecting the wells in surrounding areas.

On the flip side, when there are great amounts of rain, the water table will rise. Sometimes the rain is so great that the water table reaches the surface & the ground is saturated.

Question: What is 3 feet by 3 feet, in inches?
Answer: When you take 3 ft x 3 ft. you get 9 *square* feet.

Similarly, you would want an answer in *square* inches, not just inches.

Assuming that is what you meant, then just convert each dimension to inches and multiply.

So 3 feet x 12 inches / ft = 36 inches.

36 inches x 36 inches = 1296 *square* inches.

The temperature would fall pretty quickly, though the oceans would give us a little reprieve; temperatures would remain livable near the oceans longest, and would be coldest inland. label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: Why does a dog see fewer colors than people?
Answer: Humans have three types of color receptors (light-sensitive cells) in the retina.

Dogs have only two.  So dogs are not (as some people say) completely color blind.  They can distinguish between blues and yellows ... but not between reds and greens.

The technical terms are that humans are 'trichromatic', and dogs are 'dichromatic.'

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: a certain radioactive isotope has a half-life of 24,000 years. If there are 4 grams of the isotope remaining?
Question: a certain radioactive isotope has a half-life of 24,000 years. If there are 4 grams of the isotope remaining after 21,500 years, how many grams were there originally????
Answer: "Give a student an answer, and their grade on that assignment will go up a point, teach them how to find their answer and their score on the final exam will improve!"

Radioactive decay is an exponential thing; for every 24000 years that elapses in this problem, half the remaining material vanishes.  If you express this as an algebraic equation you can figure this stuff out easily.  The hard part is figuring out the equation.

Lets say you start out with X_0 grams of material.  The amount of material remaining is X: 

X= X_0*(1/2)^(t/24000)

Where t is given in years.  See how this works?  if t = 0, then X=X_0*1/2^0 power.  Anything raised to the 0 is always 1, so X=X_0.  At t=24000 years, X=X_0*1/2^(1), so X=X_0*1/2; half as much is left.

In this problem you are given t, and X and are asked to find X_0 so  you use a calculator to turn 1/2^(21500/24000) into just a number and then you have

4 grams=X_0*number

Pretty easy to solve that for X_0.  The point is, once you write down the equation that describes the system, you can manipulate it to solve for any of the terms in it, as long as you know the other two terms.

Incidentally, I get a different answer than those other two folks who agree with one another.  They are wrong, but not by a lot.  Work it out for yourself.

[Edit:  In fact I get the same result IMI does, so my method does work. Her answer was not posted when I started working on mine.]

Title: Help me please?
Question: MY HUSBAND AND I HAVE BEEN MARRIED FOR ABOUT 7 MONTHS. WHEN WE 1ST GOT MARRIED WE DECIDED THAT WE WANTED TO HAVE 1 CHILD TOGETHER...MIND YOU I ALREADY HAD A 3MONTH OLD THAT WASN'T HIS....I HAD MY SON B4 WE GOT INVOLVED....BUT KNOW HE DOESN'T WANT TO HAVE KIDS AND ITS ALWAYS BEEN MY DREAM TO HAVE 2 KIDS....AM I WRONG FOR BEING PISSED BECAUSE HE HAS CHANGED HIS MIND? I FEEL LIKE WE MADE PLANS AND HE KNEW HE DIDN'T WANT TO HAVE ANY KIDS... I ALSO FEEL HE SHOULDN'T HAVE MARRIED AND BEEN A FATHER TO MY NOW 9MONTH OLD SON.. IF HE DIDN'T REALLY WANT TO. HE HAS BEEN IN MY SONS LIFE AS HIS FATHER SINCE MY SON WAS 2WEEKS OLD AND NOW HE WANTS TO JUST UP AND LEAVE AND I'M SUPPOSED TO BE OKAY WITH...THAT HOW DO I STOP THE EVIL THOUGHTS RUNNING THROUGH MY HEAD I'M SO HURT I THINK I'M SLIDING INTO A DEEP DEPRESSION......HELP WHAT SHOULD I DO?
Answer: At least part of what you should do is wait. I'm a man. All men want to leave progeny. It is a biological imperitive. It sounds like he's just jealous. I hope to God your 9 month old isn't shunned by your new husband.

Men want kids (whether they admit it or not--see, there's a macho component to "siring" off-spring, it is medieval, outgrown). 

Some argue that humans, like other mammals, will only care for, really care for, their own kids-- with their genes. I don't buy this. All of us alive today share genes. It's one family, for real.

But this guy may be trying to incite a kind of hurt in you (he's succeeding) because it hurts him that he didn't father the 3/9 month old. Get it? But he'll come around! I promise.

I don't get why he did this either, if he knew about the 3-month old-he went back on his promise. Is he compulsive? Are you wealthy with your own money? People are not logical most times. That's why "game theory" doesn't work at the Pentagon or on Wall Street. We do things for neurotic, maybe self-destructive reasons. Maybe you need outside help. A marraige counselor, a shrink or two. 

Did anything change? Did he meet someone else? Think about that kind of thing. How long did you know him before marrying him, 2 1/2 months. Or maybe 3???? If so, that's not long enough. Is your Mom still alive? She'd be angry at you. Oh, I just got it:

He thinks you married him ONLY so he'll take care of your child from another person. You need a breadwinner, or at least two bread winner's, to raise a kid these days, so you married him solely so as to care for, pay for, your child.... I bet that is it. Still, you guys had wanted kids've your own, which makes it all even and ok. So there's something missing from your question. Btw, I'd get to a shrink about that depression. True major depression is crippling and life-threatening. Use words with care. True depression (clinical sense) is endogenous, of the body and heritable. So be careful.

Remind the guy that one doesn't use one's kid(s) as "weapons" to fight the spouse with... which everyone does anyway. There's more to this: you've left out or I missed something critical. But here's the general deal:

First, wait patiently. He'll change his mind again. He wants kids, we all do (us guys). If he doesn't change in, say, 6 months, he's got or having a kid with someone else I'd bet. Ask. If so he'll be a financial mess I shd think.

Also: tell him all about what it means to be a Dad, really be a Dad; and that, yes, you want HIM, you chose him, to be this child's Dad.

Tell him every damn day. For a month at least.

Finally, use sex as a weapon if you have to. Be creative. You know what he likes? Use that knowledge to give it to him, if you love him.

Hey, how to change the mind of the most stubborn guys, even in the Bible, that vixen got Sampson to cut his hair.... (Delilah, now I recall.) Making him weak (impotent). The story is saying that civilizing a man takes some of his power away. That hurts him.

So get ready to remind him, in about one month:
Being a Dad, in reality, is much more than biological parenting and soccer practice. Anyone can do that. It's raising a bright, well-adjusted (whatever that means) young adult, few can do that. Too few.

And, as mentioned, all human beings are related, so for goodnes' sake, what is the difference. OK, there is a difference. But in the past, we didn't know there's only one species of human. Mapping Human History, a new trade paperback in the popular science section of the bookstore, does a great job explaining this. 

I can see cuckoldry really hurting a guy. But not more. So why'd he marry? Why'd you marry. Good luck. PS: Do you have a sister or girlfriend he likes--be careful--its there or at work that you could lose him to another wom

Question: If a thrown ball comes into contact with a base coach who obviously is in foul territory what should the correct call by the umpire be?

"If a thrown ball accidentally touches a base coach, or a pitched or thrown ball touches an umpire, the ball is alive and in play. However, if the coach interferes with a thrown ball, the runner is out."

So, play would continue as normal assuming the coach didn't purposely interfere with the ball.

label: Sports
sentence:
Title: What qualities make a great goaltender?
Question: Like Roy - what made him the greatest (IMO)?  Or Hasek or Brodeur or even Miller...?  Is it stance, leadership, size, "je ne se qua"...?
Answer: I think every goalie has his or her own winning combination -- some of them are brainy like Roy or Shields, some are huge and massive and forwards fear them like Brodeur, some are unbelievably quick and nimble and weirdly preternatural in a scary "spidey sense" way about the puck.  Nabby was that way for a while, Toskala now.

Like any other position, I think the best goalies reinvent the game at their level.  They own the plays, the net, their role on the team, and I don't think that necessarily amounts to leadership, but it does come from things like maturity and a certain solid footing.  Um, no pun intended.

I think some of the things I look for in a goalie I play with in rec are similar in pro hockey.  I don't like goalies who fall apart after letting one or two in, or goalies who are inflexible in their approach, which means they can only shut out certain teams and only if we defend a certain way in front of them.

I like playing with goalies who are fluid about the game, not prima donnas, who can clear their own crease if they have to and who can and will drive the game from the net if the situation warrants it.  Goaltending isn't for the fainthearted, and there's some wussy goalies out there.  I don't think, long term rec or pro, they do very well.

I was sad to see Shields go so completely downhill.  He was amazing to watch when he was at his best, and I wish he'd seen his full potential.  I'm watching Aebischer and Toskala now, of the new generation.  Then again, I know jack about goalies except for living with one.  

They have too much expensive gear and they leave it lying around all over the !@#!!! house.  That's my opinion on goalies.  How's that?  :p

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Title: What is the biggest mistake you have made in a real estate transaction?
Question: Buying or selling real estate, what has been your biggest mistake.  Was it the agent you hired, doing rehab work that didn't pay off, not hiring a good inspector, financing? \n\nWhat do you wish you knew then that you know now and will apply to your next real estate transaction?  Thanks!
Answer: The one thing I think about is when I bought a rental property, I made my offer, not knowing about negotiating tactics.  The buyer agent had me sign a dual agency agreement, and I don't think he had my best interests at heart. I offered a low price and ended up paying full price.  I was naive to the fact that he was not on my side, and also, I should have asked for closing costs or some other bargaining chip.  And I should have stood my ground on the slightly lower price, after coming up some.  Being in the investor shoes, the buyer needed me more than I needer her.  I could've walked away, but she needed to sell.  So she probably would've taken the lower price had I stopped.  Overall, I do not regret the investment, it was good, I am also lucky because I didn't order an inspection!!!  (Naive again) Lucky it was in good shape.  But it also could've been a bargaining chip.  Had I gotten a lower price, I'd of had more equity now.

label: Health
sentence:
Title: Help!  My father in law has cancer and I need to know . . .?
Question: He was diagnosed with Lymphoma last Wednesday.  The doctor said to come at 4:45 today.  He told my F-I-L that he would most likely be there in consultation until at least 7 pm, and to bring his wife and ONE NON-FAMILY MEMBER.  We are all wondering, what does it mean to be asked to bring ONE NON-FAMILY MEMBER. Is this standard for a new cancer patient discovering his diagnosis, or does this probably intimate some very bad news is coming our way?

Please give me any insight you may have!
Answer: The first thing that you need to do is calm down.  I work in cancer research and at one of the best cancer treatment hospitals in the country.  This is a very standard procedure for someone who is newly diagnosed.  Your FIL and the family are going to need a lot of support and a lot of help throughout this entire time.

The doctors understand that your family will be over-emotional during this time and a NON family member will be able to take in information as well as convey information better after the consultation is over.  You should be prepared for A LOT of information to be thrown at you very quickly.  The outside person is simply there to help with the stress of the situation as much as possible.

Please feel free to email me if you need to talk to an outside source I would be really happy to help you and your family riklynn10@hotmail.com

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: When mass falls into a black hole does the black hole become larger?
Question: If this is the case what rule limits the size of the hole based on the objects it takes in.
Answer: Yes it does get bigger. But so does the Earth. I mean, when a meteor falls to Earth, it never flies back up, does it? People have this idea that black holes are somehow different because even light cannot escape their gravity. If light cannot escape, nothing else can either, so the black hole will eventually eat all the matter in the universe, right? Well, light can escape from Earth but nothing else can, at least not naturally. Meteors fall to Earth all the time and they have no rocket engines so they can never escape. This is true for any matter that falls to Earth. It can never escape. And the Earth is not eating all the matter in space, so why would you think a black hole would?

label: Entertainment & Music
sentence:
Question: what is the name of the second nine inch nails album released 1992?
Answer: Broken\n\nNIN's second major release was Broken (1992), an EP of six tracks plus two bonus tracks. It was originally released in a fold-out format, containing the first six tracks on a regular CD and an additional three-inch mini-CD with the remaining bonus tracks. It was later released as one CD, with the bonus songs as "hidden" tracks 98 and 99. The song "Wish", aided by the video directed by Peter 'Sleazy' Christopherson of Coil, won a Grammy in the "metal" category. Jon Reiss directed a music video for "Happiness in Slavery," which was almost universally banned due to its graphic content. The video depicts performance artist Bob Flanagan strapping himself to a machine that subsequently pleasures, tortures and kills him. A video for "Pinion" aired twice on MTV before being banned for its objectionable content, although images from it did become a fixture in the opening title sequence of the MTV show Alternative Nation. A full length video informally called The Broken Movie was also made by Sleazy, but has not seen an official release. The Broken Movie, as of 2005, can only be found on bootleg. Broken was followed by the remix EP Fixed.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: If space is a vacuum, wouldn't spacecrafts implode rather than explode?
Answer: To allow any astronauts  on board to breathe, the cabin would be be pressurized with a breathable atmosphere.  This internal pressure would be greater than the (very tiny) pressure outside the spacecraft.  And just like increasing the pressure inside a balloon by blowing into it causes it to expand, this increased pressure inside the spacecraft would, if there was a catastrophic failure of some kind, cause the space craft to explode rather than implode.  The exact opposite happens to submarines that are deep underwater.  If something happens to a submarine at depth, it will implode as the pressure of the water around it is greater than the pressure of the interior spaces.

Title: guardian angel??
Question: Do you believe in guardian angels??
Answer: About four years ago I was driving home from a party with two friends when we came across this car crash on Highway 70. Three cars and a truck had hit each other on the slick over pass of a bridge and all the traffic was at a stop. We were close enough that I could take out my camera and take a photo of the scene. Yes, I know. How morbid but I did it anyway. When I had the film developed the picture had this white, misty thing above on of the cars that had what appeared to be wispy wings moving off the photo edge. I didn’t even know what it was until my friend grabbed my arm and told me that I had a photo of a guardian angel. I was amazed and ever since I’m sure angels exist.

Question: do you know any therapy for a leg injury ( fractured tibia and fibula)?
Answer: Ouch.  That is a serious injury.  Any time you injure a weight bearing bone, you will need a professional assessment and ongoing rehab with your Physical Therapist.  Rehab and recovery from this type of injury can take up to 6 months or longer.\n\nYou can probably look up treatment modalities for this injury on the internet (or take answers from those who do the same), but I would strongly suggest you stick with your Physical Therapist as a source of information, as your situation may be unique in relation to location of fractures, muscles affected and rehab protocols necessary for healing.

Title: Which is better? ncode six-one tour 90 or hyper prostaff 6.1 95?
Question: I'm looking for a ncode six-one tour 90 with a 4 1/4 grip. Is it better than what I currently have which is a hyper prostaff 6.1 95.
Answer: This is really a matter of preferance, they are both good frames.  I have used the Wilson 6.1 classic prostaff for years and it is comparable to the two frames you have listed.  The hyper prostaff will have a slightly larger sweetspot with the larger head size, but I have heard good things about the ncode six-one tour.  Another racket to consider which I have recently played with is the Head liquidmetal prestige red frame.  It has a denser string pattern but suprisingly generates a generous amount of spin.  Actually it took me about 3 days of hitting before i really started liking the Head Prestige, but it was time well spent.  You may want to change to the n-code for no other reason except the hyper prostaff could be discontinued in the near future.  Anyways, good luck with your choice.

label: Health
sentence:
Title: The skin on the right ride of my stomach is very hot. about 5". stomach pain last night. What could this be?
Question: 25 yo male, smoker, drinker, 211 lbs, 5'7", no allergies, no surgeries, no previous bodily trauma to the area, never get sick. hypoglocemia, high bilirubin count, no reason for infection, no chemical contact known.
Answer: I agree with coccanut it could be a sign of infection or appenditcis, you need to get it checked out immediately. When you push on it do you feel pain? 

Information on the appendix:

The appendix is a small finger-like pouch that protrudes from the large intestine. Appendicitis, which is most common in people ages 5 to 30, is generally caused by an obstruction that leads to inflammation of the appendix. There are no particular risk factors for appenditicis. It is not preventable, so early detection is very important. 
 .   Watch for signs of pain and/or tenderness in the navel area that moves towards the lower right of the abdomen over the course of a few hours. The pain is often described as severe and sharp and worsens with any movement.  
  
2.   Take your temperature - a low grade fever may be a sign of inflammation and infection, a possible sign of appendicitis.  
3.   Watch for signs of nausea, vomiting, or loss of appetite.  
  
4.   Call your health care provider if you exhibit any and/or all of these signs and symptoms. If you are unable to reach your health care provider, go directly to the nearest emergency facility.  
  
P>S> Footnote : I'm not a doctor nor do I claim to have any knowledge, but the high bilirubin could also be gallbladder you really need to go asap to a walk in clinic or a hospital. 

I hope this helps

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Title: Are reverse mortgages really a good deal?
Question: Due to financial changes in my life I am considering whether or not a reverse mortgage is all that the banks say they are or just another money-making banking scheme.
Answer: 'm sorry but there are many misconceptions out there about reverse mortgages. Many of them are listed by some of these replies. Yes they are real.

They were set up by FHA and heavily lobbied by AARP in order to help Senior citizens because they know that social security and pensions do not cut it for a lot of people.

I recommend going to aarp to find some really helpful information.

http://www.aarp.org/money/revmort/...

or here for the most frequently asked questions..

http://www.griffinloans.com/faqs.html...

There really is only one downside to taking out a reverse mortgage. The children are not left with 100% of the value of the home for an inheritance. From my experience and my own personal view, most children would want their parents to live their life to the fullest and don't care if part of their inheritance is reduced. It is YOUR home and you worked hard to pay for it. You should enjoy the benefits of it.

The house is still in your name it just shows that there is a mortgage on the home like any other conventional mortgage. You can take the full amount in a lump sum, split it up in monthly payments or leave it in a line of credit which right now has a growth rate of about 7%. With the line of credit you are only charged interest on what you pull out of the line of credit and that interest rate right now is right around 6.5%. The rest of the money sits there untouched until you need it. These loans are set up so that there should always be equity in the home to pass along to your heirs. Also, you can repay the loan at anytime with no prepayment penalty.

All of this money is tax free and there are no monthly payments to make. You CAN make a payment if you want and are concerned about keeping the balance down. You even get a tax break if you pay back the interest you are being charged.

This is a much better option than a home equity loan which you have to make high monthly payments and if something happens and they get behind could lose their home. With an FHA reverse mortgage there is NO way to ever lose your home or be foreclosed on.

So really the only downside to reverse mortgages is that the heirs wouldn't get 100% of the home value for your inheritance.

I'd be happy to send you some more information if you would like. This is what I specialize in and our company can do reverses almost anywhere in the country. If you would like some more information please email me at bburns@griffinloans.com

label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Title: Having been on holiday to destinations which are known to have a large Catholic following........?
Question: such as Ireland, Spain, Italy and the Phillapines. I have noticed that these countries are also, to my suprise, very tolerent of Gay people. Why is this?
Answer: ok spud, its not just 'gay' people.  it's people in general.

years ago i was an unhappy Baptist.  being baptist just wasn't doing it for me and i had been born and raised in that faith.

a lot of the baptists i knew were mean spirited and hateful. they also had the "we're the only ones going to heaven" attitude.  i began looking for another faith.  that is a HARD thing to do, believe me.

i worked in a pharmacy where one of the employees was obnoxious about his protestant faith.  if you asked him how he was he'd say "He was fine ever since he became a Christian." if you asked him what he knew he'd say "I know I'm saved."  and on and on and on.  there were also a couple of Catholics that worked in the pharmacy.  when steve the protestant was telling people why they were going to hell the Catholics never were mean or hateful to anyone. they accepted everyone, it seemed.  they accepted me---even though i didn't know what i was and they accepted steve even when he was telling them they worshipped statues.

i thought to myself, there has got to be something to what these people believe, i want whatever that is for myself.

i asked them how i could learn more about the Catholic Church and they told me about classes that were given at the local parish.  i went and talked to the priest and he signed me right up.  six months of classes later, i knew i'd found what i was looking for.  i joined the Catholic Church way back in 1980 and its been an important part of my life ever since.

so---i don't think its just gays.  Catholics seem to be tolerant of just about everybody.  And that's a good thing.
